title: Labour ready for difficult decisions in new age of insecurity, Starmer says
description: Sir Keir Starmer will insist Labour can deliver ‘security for decades’ as he addresses his party’s Scottish conference in Glasgow on Sunday.

title: Labour ready for difficult decisions in new age of insecurity, Starmer says
description: Sir Keir Starmer will insist Labour can deliver ‘security for decades’ as he addresses his party’s Scottish conference in Glasgow on Sunday.

title: Venues ‘should ban political events’ over car policy
description: Glasgow City Council's latest anti-vehicle plans have prompted calls for hospitality venues to stop hosting events for politicians until the proposals are dropped.

title: Greens criticised for ‘perverse’ call to ban Israel from sporting and music events
description: The Green Party has been criticised for a “perverse and wrong-headed” social media post calling for Israel to be banned from international sporting and music events. On Friday, the Greens posted a political advert on X, formerly known as Twitter, describing the actions it said were necessary to “stop the killing in Gaza”.

title: General election is not a done deal…but disillusioned Tory voters staying home is straw that PM & the party must grasp

title: Clubland By The Sea festival returns to Hartlepool
description: Clubland By The Sea festival returns to host an outdoor party on Friday, July 26 at Seaton Reach, Hartlepool in the North East.

title: Thousands march to Scottish Labour conference in Gaza ceasefire protest
description: Demonstrators marched through Glasgow as Scottish Labour delegates gathered. Thousands of pro-Palestinian demonstrators have marched through Glasgow to protest outside the Scottish Labour conference taking place in the city, calling for an immediate ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.

title: Flying high! Eco-warriors Harry and Meghan are seen jetting home to California after whirlwind Canadian visit - amid rumors prince may resume royal duties

title: Conservatives face 'extinction' unless they change course, warns top Tory
description: To be clear, what Rishi Sunak and the Conservatives are facing is a potential extinction event rather than a defeat. What makes this political implosion all the more remarkable, is that no one I speak to in my Red Wall constituency of Rossendale and Darwen in Lancashire seems to even like Keir Stammer or be clamouring for a Labour Government.

title: Only people-friendly roads will reduce traffic congestion, ADPD says

title: LETTERS - Green washing, council defection and council houses

title: Vital services to get £510k funding boost in revised budget proposals
